body_html:
@gchanan based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/773030/why-are-0d-arrays-in-numpy-not-considered-scalar, I think numpy has both 0-d array and scalar, just for interoperability with other Python libraries, such as math. If numpy can be designed without consideration of other libraries, I bet only 0-d array will be there.

I think it's easier to simply only have 0-d array, as done in TensorFlow.

body:
@gchanan based on <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/773030/why-are-0d-arrays-in-numpy-not-considered-scalar>, I think numpy has both 0-d array and scalar, just for interoperability with other Python libraries, such as `math`. If numpy can be designed without consideration of other libraries, I bet only 0-d array will be there.

I think it's easier to simply only have 0-d array, as done in TensorFlow.
